In 2023, Schwab opted to buy down $5.0 billion of fixed-rate obligations, incurring $249 million in fees, but did not migrate balances to its balance sheet. The 2023 agreement eliminated the 80% fixed-rate requirement but introduced new minimum and maximum IDA balance thresholds.  
- **Balance Requirements**: Through September 10, 2025, Schwab must maintain minimum balances above total outstanding fixed-rate obligations, with a $30 billion cap. - **2023 Agreement Term**: Extended to July 1, 2034, with adjustments to migration flexibility and balance thresholds. As of December 31, 2024, total IDA balances were $87.6 billion, split between fixed-rate ($66.6B) and floating-rate ($21.0B).
